alert.note: Alert for Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 07 at 6:36PM CST until January 07 at 7:30PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR HARRIS COUNTY... At 636 PM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5.5 inches of rain have fallen. Although the heaviest rainfall is beginning to very slowly push southward, flash flooding remains a possibility. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sheldon and Hunterwood. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
